intro: Psychotria clausa, commonly known as the "closed psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria clausa is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
